drug.name: Florfenicol
drug.description: Florfenicol is a fluorinated synthetic analog of thiamphenicol.

article.citation: Picco EJ, Diaz DC, Valtorta SE, Boggi JC: Chronotoxicology of florfenicol. Chronobiol Int. 2001 May;18(3):567-72.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as benzenesulfonyl compounds. These are aromatic compounds containing a benzenesulfonyl group, which consists of a monocyclic benzene moiety that carries a sulfonyl group.

drug-interaction.name: Picosulfuric acid
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Picosulfuric acid can be decreased when used in combination with Florfenicol.

drug-interaction.name: BCG vaccine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of BCG vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Florfenicol.

drug-interaction.name: Typhoid vaccine
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Typhoid vaccine can be decreased when used in combination with Florfenicol.

drug-interaction.name: Dicoumarol
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Florfenicol is combined with Dicoumarol.

drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of bleeding can be increased when Florfenicol is combined with Phenindione.
